translated: When someone passes away from the sense-sphere realm and is not reborn in the formless realm, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.

original: Kāmadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā🔽anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā🔽bhaṅgā natthi. Kāmadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci

translated: When someone passes away from the sense-sphere realm and is not reborn in the sense-sphere realm or the formless realm, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie,🔽for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking of the underlying tendencies. When someone passes away from the sense-sphere realm and is not reborn in the form realm or the formless realm, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie,

original: satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Kāmadhātuyā
analyzed: satta anusayā anusenti kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti anusayā bhaṅgā natthi kāmadhātuyā
translated: for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking of the underlying tendencies. When someone passes away from the sense-sphere realm and is not reborn in the sense-sphere realm or the formless realm or the form realm, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie,🔽for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking of the underlying tendencies.

original: cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ na rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: cutassa na kāmadhātum na rūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: When someone who has died in the formless world is not being reborn in the sense-sphere or the fine-material world, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. (Kāmadhātumūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi kāmadhātu mūlaka
translated: for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies. (The sense-sphere is the root.)

original: Rūpadhātuyā cutassa rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci
analyzed: rūpadhātuyā cutassa rūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci

original: pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Rūpadhātuyā
analyzed: pañca anusayā anusenti kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi rūpadhātuyā
translated: there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.

original: cutassa kāmadhātuṁ upapajjantassa satteva anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: cutassa kāmadhātum upapajjantassa sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi
translated: When someone who has died in the fine-material world is being reborn in the sense-sphere, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.

original: Rūpadhātuyā cutassa arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā cutassa a rūpa dhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci
translated: When someone who has died in the fine-material world is being reborn in the formless world, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie, for some

original: pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: pañca anusayā anusenti kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.

original: Rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: When someone who has died in the fine-material world is not being reborn in the sense-sphere, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: for some, three underlying tendencies underlie; there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies.

original: Rūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: rūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: For one who has died in the form element and is not being reborn in the form element, for some, seven underlying tendencies underlie,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: for some, five underlying tendencies underlie, for some, three underlying tendencies underlie; there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies.

original: Rūpadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā cutassa na arūpa dhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: For one who has died in the form element and is not being reborn in the formless element, for some, seven underlying tendencies underlie,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: for some, five underlying tendencies underlie, for some, three underlying tendencies underlie; there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies.

original: Rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā
analyzed: rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum na arūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā
translated: For one who has died in the form element and is not being reborn in the sense-sphere element or the formless element, for some, seven underlying tendencies underlie,

original: anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā
analyzed: anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayā
translated: for some, five underlying tendencies underlie, for some, three underlying tendencies underlie; there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies.

original: bhaṅgā natthi. Rūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa satteva
analyzed: bhaṅgā natthi rūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātum na arūpadhātum upapajjantassa sattā iva
translated: For one who has died in the form element and is not being reborn in the form element or the formless element, for some, seven underlying tendencies underlie,

original: anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ na rūpadhātuṁ
analyzed: anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum na rūpadhātu

original: upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci
analyzed: upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci

original: tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. (Rūpadhātumūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: tayo anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi rūpadhātu mūlaka
translated: in some cases three underlying tendencies underlie; there is no breaking of the underlying tendencies. (The fine-material realm.)

original: Arūpadhātuyā cutassa arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci
analyzed: arūpadhātuyā cutassa arūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci
translated: When one who has died in the immaterial realm is being reborn in the immaterial realm, in some cases seven underlying tendencies underlie, in some cases

original: pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Arūpadhātuyā
analyzed: pañca anusayā anusenti kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi arūpadhātuyā
translated: five underlying tendencies underlie, in some cases three underlying tendencies underlie; there is no breaking of the underlying tendencies. When one who has died in the immaterial realm is being reborn in the sense sphere,

original: cutassa kāmadhātuṁ upapajjantassa satteva anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: cutassa kāmadhātum upapajjantassa sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi
translated: seven underlying tendencies underlie; there is no breaking of the underlying tendencies.

original: Arūpadhātuyā cutassa rūpadhātuyā upapatti nāma natthi, heṭṭhā upapajjamāno kāmadhātuṁyeva
analyzed: arūpadhātuyā cutassa rūpadhātuyā upapatti nāma natthi heṭṭhā upapajjamānaḥ kāmadhātuyā iva
translated: When one who has died in the immaterial realm is not being reborn in the fine-material realm, there is no rebirth below; being reborn above,

original: upapajjati, satteva anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: upapajjati sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi
translated: he is reborn only in the sense sphere. Seven underlying tendencies underlie; there is no breaking of the underlying tendencies.

original: Arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: When one who has passed away from the formless world is not reappearing in the sensual world, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies.

original: Arūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: arūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: When one who has passed away from the formless world is not reappearing in the form world, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies.

original: Arūpadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa satteva anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: arūpadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātum upapajjantassa sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi
translated: When one who has passed away from the formless world is not reappearing in the formless world, there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies.

original: Arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā upapatti nāma natthi, heṭṭhā🔽upapajjamāno kāmadhātuṁyeva upapajjati, satteva anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā
analyzed: arūpa dhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuyā na arūpa dhātuyā upapatti nāma natthi heṭṭhā  upapajjamānaḥ kāmadhātuyā iva upapajjati sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ
translated: When one who has passed away from the formless world is not reappearing in the sensual world or the formless world, there is no reappearance called ‘ reappearance in the sensual world ’ ;

original: natthi. Arūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa satteva
analyzed: natthi arūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātum na arūpadhātum upapajjantassa sattā iva
translated: reappearing below, he reappears only in the sensual world; there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies. When one who has passed away from the formless world is not reappearing in the form world or the formless world, there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie;

original: anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ na rūpadhātuṁ
analyzed: anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum na rūpadhātu
translated: When someone dying in the formless world is not being reborn in the sense-sphere or fine-material worlds,

original: upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci
analyzed: upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci
translated: for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie,

original: tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. (Arūpadhātumūlakaṁ.)🔽Na kāmadhātuyā cutassa kāmadhātuṁ upapajjantassa satteva anusayā anusenti; anusayā
analyzed: tayo anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi arūpa dhātu mūlaka  na kāmadhātuyā cutassa kāmadhātum upapajjantassa sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti anusayā
translated: for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies. (The formless-world base.)

original: bhaṅgā natthi. Na kāmadhātuyā cutassa rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā🔽anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā🔽bhaṅgā natthi. Na kāmadhātuyā cutassa arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā
analyzed: bhaṅgā natthi na kāmadhātuyā cutassa rūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā  anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayā  bhaṅgā natthi na kāmadhātuyā cutassa arūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā
translated: When someone dying in the sense-sphere is being reborn in the sense-sphere, for him there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.🔽When someone dying in the sense-sphere is being reborn in the fine-material world, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.

original: anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: When someone dying in the sense-sphere is being reborn in the formless world, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie; there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.

original: Na kāmadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: na kāmadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: When someone who has died in the sense-sphere realm is not being reborn in the sense-sphere realm, seven of his latent tendencies are active,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: five of his latent tendencies are active, and three of his latent tendencies are active; there is no breaking of the latent tendencies.

original: Na kāmadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: na kāmadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: When someone who has died in the sense-sphere realm is not being reborn in the form-sphere realm, seven of his latent tendencies are active,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: five of his latent tendencies are active, and three of his latent tendencies are active; there is no breaking of the latent tendencies.

original: Na kāmadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti,
analyzed: na kāmadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: When someone who has died in the sense-sphere realm is not being reborn in the formless-sphere realm, seven of his latent tendencies are active,

original: kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: five of his latent tendencies are active, and three of his latent tendencies are active; there is no breaking of the latent tendencies.

original: Na kāmadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta
analyzed: na kāmadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum na arūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci
translated: When someone who has died in the sense-sphere realm is not being reborn in the sense-sphere realm or the formless-sphere realm, seven of his latent tendencies are active,

original: anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti;
analyzed: anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti

original: anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti;
analyzed: anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: For one who has died in the formless world and is not being reborn in the sense world, for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie;

original: anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa
analyzed: anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātum upapajjantassa
translated: there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies. For one who has died in the formless world and is not being reborn in the form world,

original: kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā
analyzed: kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ
translated: for some there are seven underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are five underlying tendencies that underlie, for some there are three underlying tendencies that underlie;

original: anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātuṁ
analyzed: anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātu
translated: there is no breaking up of underlying tendencies. For one who has died in the formless world and is not being reborn in the formless world,

original: upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci
analyzed: upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci
translated: For some, seven underlying tendencies underlie when they are being reborn. For some, five underlying tendencies underlie when they are being reborn. For some,

original: tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: tayo anusayā anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi
translated: three underlying tendencies underlie when they are being reborn. There is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.

original: Na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa
analyzed: na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum na arūpadhātum upapajjantassa
translated: For one who has died in the formless realm and is not being reborn in the form realm or the formless realm,

original: kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā
analyzed: kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ
translated: for some, seven underlying tendencies underlie. For some, five underlying tendencies underlie. For some,

original: anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ
analyzed: anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātu
translated: three underlying tendencies underlie. There is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies. For one who has died in the formless realm and is not being reborn in the form realm or the formless realm,

original: na arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā🔽anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ
analyzed: na arūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ  anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi na rūpadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātu
translated: for some, seven underlying tendencies underlie. For some, five underlying tendencies underlie.

original: na rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā
analyzed: na rūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ
translated: For one who has died in the formless realm and is not being reborn in the form realm or the formless realm, for some, seven underlying tendencies underlie. For some, five underlying tendencies underlie.

original: anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. (Narūpanaarūpadhātumūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi
translated: for some three proclivities are in operation. There is no breaking up of proclivities. (The immaterial-sphere element.)

original: Na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa kāmadhātuṁ upapajjantassa satteva anusayā anusenti;🔽anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa rūpadhātuyā upapatti
analyzed: na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa kāmadhātum upapajjantassa sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti  anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa rūpadhātuyā upapatti
translated: When one who has died in the immaterial-sphere element is reappearing in the sensual-sphere element, seven proclivities are in operation.

original: nāma natthi, heṭṭhā upapajjamāno kāmadhātuṁyeva upapajjati, satteva anusayā anusenti;
analyzed: nāma natthi heṭṭhā upapajjamānaḥ kāmadhātuyā iva upapajjati sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: There is no breaking up of proclivities. When one who has died in the immaterial-sphere element is reappearing in the immaterial-sphere element, seven proclivities are in operation.

original: anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa arūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa
analyzed: anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa a rūpadhātum upapajjantassa
translated: There is no breaking up of proclivities. When one who has died in the immaterial-sphere element is reappearing in the fine-material sphere, there is no reappearance in the fine-material sphere after dying in the immaterial-sphere element.

original: kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā
analyzed: kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ
translated: When one who has died in the immaterial-sphere element is reappearing in the sensual-sphere element, seven proclivities are in operation.

original: anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: anusenti anusayā bhaṅgā natthi
translated: for some three proclivities are in operation. There is no breaking up of proclivities.🔽When one who has died in the immaterial-sphere element is reappearing in the immaterial-sphere element, seven proclivities are in operation.🔽There is no breaking up of proclivities. When one who has died in the immaterial-sphere element is reappearing in the fine-material sphere, there is no reappearance in the fine-material sphere after dying in the immaterial-sphere element.

original: Na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta
analyzed: na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci
translated: When one who has died in the immaterial-sphere element is reappearing in the sensual-sphere element, seven proclivities are in operation.

original: anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti;
analyzed: anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: for some five underlying tendencies underlie, for some three underlying tendencies underlie.

original: anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa
analyzed: anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātum upapajjantassa
translated: There is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies. For one who has died in the sense-sphere and is not being reborn in the form-sphere

original: kassaci satta anusayā anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā
analyzed: kassaci satta anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ
translated: for some seven underlying tendencies underlie, for some five underlying tendencies underlie, for some three underlying tendencies underlie.

original: anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātuṁ
analyzed: anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na arūpadhātu
translated: There is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies. For one who has died in the sense-sphere and is not being reborn in the formless-sphere

original: upapajjantassa satteva anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi.
analyzed: upapajjantassa sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgā natthi
translated: only seven underlying tendencies underlie. There is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.

original: Na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā upapatti nāma🔽natthi, heṭṭhā upapajjamāno kāmadhātuṁyeva upapajjati, satteva anusayā anusenti;
analyzed: na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuyā na arūpadhātuyā upapatti nāma  natthi heṭṭhā upapajjamānaḥ kāmadhātuyā iva upapajjati sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti
translated: For one who has died in the sense-sphere and is not being reborn in the sense-sphere or the formless-sphere there is no rebirth

original: anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātuṁ na arūpadhātuṁ
analyzed: anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi na kāmadhātuyā na rūpadhātuyā cutassa na rūpadhātum na arūpadhātu
translated: there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies. For one who has died in the sense-sphere and is not being reborn in the form-sphere or the formless-sphere

original: upapajjantassa satteva anusayā anusenti; anusayā bhaṅgā natthi. Na kāmadhātuyā na🔽rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātuṁ na rūpadhātuṁ upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā
analyzed: upapajjantassa sattā iva anusayāḥ anusenti anusayāḥ bhaṅgāḥ natthi na kāmadhātuyā na  rūpadhātuyā cutassa na kāmadhātum na rūpadhātum upapajjantassa kassaci satta anusayā
translated: When being reborn, only the underlying tendencies underlie. There is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies.

original: anusenti, kassaci pañca anusayā anusenti, kassaci tayo anusayā anusenti; anusayā🔽bhaṅgā natthi. (Nakāmanarūpadhātumūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: anusenti kassaci pañca anusayāḥ anusenti kassaci tayaḥ anusayāḥ anusenti anusayā  bhaṅgā na atthi na kāmana rūpadhātu mūlaka
translated: When one who has died in the sense-desire element and the fine-material element is not being reborn in the sense-desire element and the fine-material element, in some cases seven underlying tendencies underlie, in some cases five underlying tendencies underlie, in some cases three underlying tendencies underlie;

original: Dhātuvisajjavāro.
analyzed: dhātu visajja vāraḥ
translated: there is no breaking up of the underlying tendencies. (The sense-desire element and the fine-material element as the source.)🔽The section on the permutation of elements is ended.

original: Anusayayamakapāḷi niṭṭhitā.
translated: The half-chapter on the underlying tendencies is ended.
